70,585 |Champion= |BowlTourney=[[2006 Alamo Bowl|Alamo Bowl]] |BowlTourneyResult=L 26-24 vs. [[2006 Texas Longhorns football team|Texas]] |uniform=File:BigTen-Uniform-Iowa-2006-2008.png }} {{2006 Big Ten football standings}} The '''2006 Iowa Hawkeyes football team''' represented the [[University of Iowa]] during the [[2006 NCAA Division I FBS football season|2006 college football season]]. The Hawkeyes played their home games at [[Kinnick Stadium]] and were coached by [[Kirk Ferentz]]. They completed the season with a 6-7 record which included a [[Big Ten]] record of 2-6. ==Preseason== {{Empty section|date=May 2008}} ==Schedule== {{CFB Schedule Humphrey Metrodome]] | site_cityst = [[Minneapolis, Minnesota|Minneapolis, MN]] | gamename = | tv = ESPN Plus | score = 34-24 | overtime = | attend = 64,140 }} {{CFB Schedule Entry | date = 12/30/2006 | time = 3:30 p.m. | w/l = l | nonconf = yes | homecoming = | away = | neutral = yes | rank = | opponent = [[2006 Texas Longhorns football team|Texas]] | opprank = 16 | site_stadium = [[Alamodome]] | site_cityst = [[San Antonio, Texas|San Antonio, TX]] | gamename = [[2006 Alamo Bowl|Alamo Bowl]] | tv = ESPN | score = 26-24 | overtime = | attend = 65,875 }} {{CFB Schedule End|rank=|poll=|timezone=[[Central Time]]}} ==Roster== {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} ==Game notes== ===Montana=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road=Grizzlies |R1=0 |R2=0 |R3=7 |R4=0 |Home='''Hawkeyes''' |H1=7 |H2=10 |H3=7 |H4=17 }} {{-}} ===Syracuse=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road='''Hawkeyes''' |R1=0 |R2=7 |R3=3 |R4=0 |R5=3 |R6=7 |Home=Orange |H1=7 |H2=0 |H3=0 |H4=3 |H5=3 |H6=0 }} {{-}} ===Iowa State=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road=Cyclones |R1=7 |R2=7 |R3=3 |R4=0 |Home='''Hawkeyes''' |H1=3 |H2=7 |H3=7 |H4=10 }} {{-}} ===Illinois=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road='''Hawkeyes''' |R1=0 |R2=21 |R3=0 |R4=3 |Home=Fighting Illini |H1=0 |H2=0 |H3=0 |H4=7 }} {{-}} ===Ohio State=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road='''Buckeyes''' |R1=7 |R2=14 |R3=7 |R4=10 |Home=Hawkeyes |H1=3 |H2=7 |H3=0 |H4=7 }} {{-}} ===Purdue=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road=Boilermakers |R1=0 |R2=3 |R3=14 |R4=0 |Home='''Hawkeyes''' |H1=14 |H2=6 |H3=14 |H4=13 }} {{-}} The Iowa Hawkeyes welcomed Purdue to Kinnick Stadium one week after losing their much anticipated game against top-ranked Ohio State. Iowa jumped on Purdue early and often, opening up a 14-0 first quarter lead with a touchdown run by Damian Sims and a pass from quarterback Drew Tate to fullback Tom Busch. Kyle Schlicher added two field goals in the second quarter and the Hawkeyes lead 20-3 at halftime. Purdue's only first half scoring came on a 44 yard field goal by freshman Chris Summers. Sims scored again on Iowa's first possession of the second half before Greg Orton caught a 18 yard touchdown pass from Curtis Painter. Tate then hit tight end Scott Chandler for a touchdown and Purdue then responded with a Jaycen Taylor touchdown run. The Boilermakers could get no closer as they were shut out in the fourth quarter. Shonn Greenne scored on a short run and Adam Shada returned an interception of a Curtis Painter pass 98 yards for a touchdown. ===Indiana=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road=Hawkeyes |R1=14 |R2=7 |R3=0 |R4=7 |Home='''Hoosiers''' |H1=7 |H2=10 |H3=7 |H4=7 }} {{-}} ===Michigan=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road=Hawkeyes |R1=0 |R2=0 |R3=6 |R4=0 |Home='''Wolverines''' |H1=0 |H2=3 |H3=7 |H4=10 }} {{-}} ===Northern Illinois=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road=Huskies |R1=0 |R2=0 |R3=0 |R4=14 |Home='''Hawkeyes''' |H1=7 |H2=10 |H3=0 |H4=7 }} {{-}} ===Northwestern=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road='''Wildcats''' |R1=7 |R2=7 |R3=0 |R4=7 |Home=Hawkeyes |H1=0 |H2=0 |H3=7 |H4=0 }} {{-}} ===Wisconsin=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road='''Badgers''' |R1=10 |R2=7 |R3=0 |R4=7 |Home=Hawkeyes |H1=0 |H2=14 |H3=0 |H4=7 }} {{-}} ===Minnesota=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road=Hawkeyes |R1=7 |R2=10 |R3=0 |R4=7 |Home='''Golden Gophers''' |H1=6 |H2=14 |H3=7 |H4=7 }} {{-}} ===Alamo Bowl - Texas=== {{Main|2006 Alamo Bowl}} {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road='''Longhorns''' |R1=3 |R2=7 |R3=10 |R4=6 |Home=Hawkeyes |H1=14 |H2=0 |H3=7 |H4=3 }} {{-}} {{IowaFootballSeasons}} {{DEFAULTSORT:2006 Iowa Hawkeyes Football Team}} [[Category:2006 Big Ten Conference football season|Iowa]] [[Category:Iowa Hawkeyes football seasons]]
